00025 namespace agg
00026 {
00027     class render_buffer;
00028 
00029     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00030     // A set of render classes. These classes also do not depend on the 
00031     // programming platform, but they DO depend on the pixel format.
00032     // Thre's a number of such kind of classes that supports different 
00033     // formats (BGR888 - three bytes per pixel, RGB565 - two bytes, RGBA8888 - 
00034     // four bytes and so on). This very class is the first written, so it has 
00035     // such a long introduction :-)
00036     // Although the classes have some common properties they do not have any 
00037     // common base class. This is because they have a method "copy_from" that
00038     // is very useful but can be only called for the same class (f.e., copying
00039     // from BGR to RGB  requires converting). Besides it's better 
00040     // to keep the absolute minimum of coupling, still if you really want to you 
00041     // can easily create wrappers with all virtual functions you need.
00042     //
00043     // This classes are used as base ones for a number of scanline renderers, 
00044     // such as render_NNNN_solid, render_NNNN_stencil, render_NNNN_image, and 
00045     // so on. The only purpose of these base classes is to keep a pointer to 
00046     // the rendering buffer and provide a number of useful functions, such as
00047     // clear(), put_pixel(), get_pixel(), rectangle(), copy_from().
00048     //
00049     // They do not have a virtual destructor (and any virtuals at all), so they
00050     // are not suppose to be used as polymorhic types.
00051     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052     class render_bgr24
00053     {
00054     public:
00055         render_bgr24(render_buffer* rbuf) :
00056             m_rbuf(rbuf)
00057         {
00058         }
00059 
00060         void  clear(const color& c);
00061         void  put_pixel(int x, int y, const color& c);
00062         color get_pixel(int x, int y);
00063         void  rectangle(rect rc, const color& c);
00064         void  copy_from(render_bgr24* from, rect rc_from, int x_to, int y_to);
00065 
00066     protected:
00067         render_buffer* rbuf() { return m_rbuf; }
00068 
00069     private:
00070         render_buffer* m_rbuf;
00071     };
00072 
00073 
00074 }
